page.title: 14EVENTS-LOCAL NEWS-CONTINUED
page.content: DR PRYKE'S RETIREMENT-Great Paxton and Offord villagers said goodbye to their parish priest on May 31st.Dr EDWARD PRYKE has been vicar to both parishes for 8 years and he and his wife are taking up a well earned retirement in Devon. On May 22nd the local elections were held . 77 county council seats were being contested in Cambridgeshire the resultsfor Paxton and Offords were Michael Edwards (conservative)-1722 votes Clive Attard (labour) 552 votes. Mrs Betty Spencer of Offord is trying to save a riverside meadow from becoming a gravel pit. She is asking local people for support.Cromwell Morris Men danced at the Bell.All proceeds in aid of local charities.
